fact: "Bennie Thompson actively cheer-led riots in the ’90s."

articles.title: Matt Gaetz - PolitiFact
articles.snippet: “Bennie Thompson actively cheer-led riots in the '90s.” false. By Yacob Reyes • June 13, 2022. Matt Gaetz. stated on March 31, 2022 in a Twitter thread ...
articles.summary:
Matt Gaetz was elected to Congress in 2016 representing Florida's 1st District.
Gaetz resigned from Congress on Nov. 13, 2024, just before President-elect Donald Trump nominated him for U.S. attorney general.
Gaetz withdrew from consideration for attorney general Nov. 22, 2024, amid allegations of sexual misconduct and said he wouldn't rejoin Comgress.
He was elected to the Florida House of Representatives serving District 4 in 2010.
His father is former Florida state Sen. Don Gaetz.

articles.summary:
Sign up for PolitiFact textsCould Hassan have possibly spent an entire month outside of the state from February through April?
That paper’s reporter Dan Tuohy wrote about the governor’s schedule that month, which included 12 days "out of New Hampshire" for political travel.
On April 1, it sent a letter outlining her eight days of out-of-state political travel that month.
For the 14 other days of travel, Hassan spent at least some of her time here.
Maggie Hassan was "out of state on 30 days over the last three months."

articles.title: Maggie Hassan says Kelly Ayotte repeatedly voted ... - PolitiFact
articles.snippet: Apr 29, 2016 ... Says Maggie Hassan was "out of state on 30 days over the last three months." mostly-true. By Clay Wirestone • May 27, 2016. Maggie ...
articles.summary:
On Equal Pay Day, Democrats said Republican U.S. Sen. Kelly Ayotte had not only voted against equal paychecks for women, but she had done so multiple times.
Both Governor Maggie Hassan, who is challenging Ayotte for her Senate seat, and the New Hampshire Democratic Party, blasted Ayotte in dual press releases on April 12, 2016.
"It is extremely troubling that Kelly Ayotte has voted four times against the federal Paycheck Fairness Act, which would help ensure that women can earn equal pay for equal work."
Ayotte voted against the amendment, though she did vote for an alternative Republican amendment.
Our rulingHassan said that "Kelly Ayotte has voted four times against the federal Paycheck Fairness Act."

The most up-to-date information suggests that the United States uses the majority of the world’s supply of popular versions of such drugs.

Unlike pledged delegates, who are selected in the primary, these so-called superdelegates are allowed to back whichever candidate they want.
The rest of the paragraph suggests that it’s being used as a synonym for Democratic voters, but it’s a stretch to call every voter an activist.
According to reporting from the Monitor, the state Democratic Party has 24 base delegates to award in the primary.
But strictly looking at the numerical breakdown of voters in the Democratic primary and the number of delegates, the math works out.

fact: "There are actually only 30 countries that practice birthright citizenship."

articles.title: S.E. Cupp: Only about 30 other countries offer birthright ... - PolitiFact
articles.snippet: Aug 23, 2015 ... "There are actually only 30 countries that practice birthright citizenship," she said on the Aug. 23, 2015, show, "making the US kind of an anomaly."
articles.summary:
Cupp suggested the United States’ law makes it an outlier on the issue compared to the rest of the world.
"There are actually only 30 countries that practice birthright citizenship," she said on the Aug. 23, 2015, show, "making the U.S. kind of an anomaly."
Ireland got rid of its birthright citizenship law in 2005, and France did away with its own in 1993.
Our rulingCupp said, "There are actually only 30 countries that practice birthright citizenship, making the U.S. kind of an anomaly."
Clarification: Among the 33 countries with birthright citizenship, the United States admits the highest number of immigrants per year.

fact: "My husband and I have never gotten a penny of money from the farm."

articles.title: Bachmann's Waterloo - FactCheck.org
articles.snippet: Jun 28, 2011 ... And my husband and I have never gotten a penny of money from the farm. Every year since joining Congress in 2007, Bachmann has reported that ...
articles.summary:
When she got to Waterloo to deliver her first official campaign speech, Bachmann made her now viral gaffe in saying that tough-guy actor John Wayne was from Waterloo, Iowa.
Every year since joining Congress in 2007, Bachmann has reported that she is a partner in the "Bachmann Farm Family LP" in Independence, Wisc.
A database on federal farm subsidies maintained by the nonpartisan Environmental Working Group shows that Paul Bachmann's farm received $259,332 in subsidies from 1995 through 2008.
So, Bachmann's position on earmarks is much more nuanced and complicated than she let on during her interview on Fox.
Bachmann's congressional office gave us an e-mail address for a campaign spokeswoman, and we sent requests for further explanation of those government funds and the family farm income.

articles.title: Rep. Michele Bachmann says she's never received a ... - PolitiFact
articles.snippet: Jul 1, 2011 ... "My husband and I have never gotten a penny of money from the farm." true false. National · Campaign Finance · Michele Bachmann · Robert Farley.
articles.summary:
However, records show the Bachmann Farm Family Limited Partnership was formed in 2001, and Rep. Bachmann and her husband have a stake in it.
All of Rep. Bachmann's financial disclosure forms, filed with the Clerk of the House, list the Bachmann Farm Family LP as an asset of hers worth between $100,000 and $250,000.
Paul Bachmann received nearly $260,000 in farm subsidies between 1995 and 2007, according to U.S. Department of Agriculture data compiled by the Environmental Working Group.
According to her 2009 financial disclosure form, the Bachmann Farm Family LP brought her income between $15,001 and $50,000.
The 2007 also lists farm income, but the online copy does not make clear which income range Bachmann checked that year.

articles.title: Bachmann's inaccurate statements emerge in GOP 2012 race | MPR ...
articles.snippet: Jun 28, 2011 ... And my husband and I have never gotten a penny of money from the farm." - On "Fox News Sunday." THE FACTS: In personal financial disclosure ...
articles.summary:
Rep. Michele Bachmann, R-Minn., speaks to supporters during her formal announcement to seek the 2012 Republican presidential nomination, Monday, June 27, 2011, in Waterloo, Iowa.
It was the serial killer John Wayne Gacy Jr. who lived, for a time, in Waterloo.
His father, John Adams, was the Revolutionary War figure and an architect of the declaration - and therefore a Founding Father.
THE FACTS: Wayne was born in Winterset, Iowa, nearly three hours away, and moved to California in his childhood.
---Associated Press writers Brian Bakst in Waterloo, Iowa, and Dina Cappiello in Washington contributed to this report.

articles.title: Bachmann Income Disclosure Lists Income From Farm That Got ...
articles.snippet: Aug 16, 2011 ... “And my husband and I have never gotten a penny of money from the farm.” Bachmann's financial disclosures paint a different picture. Since ...
articles.summary:
Washington – Despite repeatedly asserting that she has never received income from a family farm that has drawn federal subsidies in the past, Rep. Michele Bachmann again listed the farm as a source of income when she filed her 2010 personal financial disclosures late last week.
Bachmann, R-Minn., also reported that the farm had more than doubled in value since 2009.
The property in Independence, Wis., Bachmann Farm Family LP, received nearly $260,000 in federal subsidies between 1995 and 2008.
“It's not my (husband's) and my farm,” Bachmann said in a June interview on “Fox News Sunday,” responding to a Los Angeles Times report about the farm subsidies and other government aid the Bachmann family has received over the years.
In a statement Monday, her campaign said all farm income allocated to Bachmann and her immediate family was retained by the farm, so “they did not directly benefit from the farm income or subsidies.” The statement also said that her late father-in-law had applied for the subsidies, and that the farm had not received any since he died in 2009.

articles.title: Michele Bachmann launches 2012 presidential bid | Michele ...
articles.snippet: Jun 27, 2011 ... And my husband and I have never gotten a penny of money from the farm." But, according to the Los Angeles Times, Bachmann's financial ...
articles.summary:
Bachmann has called for corporate tax cuts, the scrapping of some environmental laws and the phasing out of a number of personal taxes.
Bachmann played to her local roots, telling Iowans that she cried when her mother told her the family was leaving the state for Minnesota.
Asked about the payments on Fox News, Bachmann said that her family never directly profited from the farm subsidies.
But, according to the Los Angeles Times, Bachmann's financial disclosure forms for the past two years show her receiving between $15,000 and $50,000 from the Bachmann Family Farm LP.
"First of all, the money that went to the clinic was actually training money for employees," Bachmann said.

fact: "The American people say, don't touch Social Security, don't touch Medicare, don't cut defense. That's 84 percent of the federal budget."

articles.title: The Insider | InsideDefense.com
articles.snippet: ... The American people say don't touch Social Security, don't touch Medicare, don't cut defense. That's 84 percent of the federal budget. . . . So, you know ...
articles.summary:
With the government spending more than $500 billion per year on contracts for goods and services -- a large chunk of which comes from the Pentagon -- the Office of Management and Budget has launched a "myth-busting" campaign to improve communication between federal acquisition officials and industry contractors.
Our industry partners are often the best source of this information, so productive interactions between federal agencies and our industry partners should be encouraged to ensure that the government clearly understands the marketplace and can award a contract or order for an effective solution at a reasonable price.
Early, frequent, and constructive engagement with industry is especially important for complex, high-risk procurements, including (but not limited to) those for large information technology (IT) projects.
This is why increasing communication, in the form of a "myth-busters" educational campaign, is one of the key tenets of the Office of Management and Budget's 25-Point Implementation Plan to Reform Federal IT Management.
The Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) authorizes a broad range of opportunities for vendor communication, but agencies often do not take full advantage of these existing flexibilities.

fact: "Since 1978, CEO compensation rose over 1,000% and only 11.9% for average workers."

articles.title: Yes, pay for CEOs has far outpaced compensation for ... - PolitiFact
articles.snippet: Jun 2, 2021 ... "Since 1978, CEO compensation rose over 1,000% and only 11.9% for average workers." Sign up for PolitiFact texts ...
articles.summary:
Meanwhile, annual pay for the average worker increased only 11.9% during those four decades, the report found.
The August 2019 report reviewed pay for CEOs and average workers at America’s top 350 firms through 2018.
It calculated findings based on two measures: wages based on stock options realized, which fluctuates with the stock market, and based on stock options granted.
Under the latter measure, the average CEO’s annual wage grew 1,007.5% between 1978 and 2018, as Barnes said.
Our ratingBarnes said CEO compensation has risen more than 1,000% since 1978, while wages for the average worker have only increased 11.9%.
